body.p: The cost of an internally generated intangible asset comprises all directly attributable costs necessary to create, produce, and prepare the asset to be capable of operating in the manner intended by management. Examples of directly attributable costs are:

li.p: costs of materials and services used or consumed in generating the intangible asset;
costs of employee benefits (as defined in IAS 19) arising from the generation of the intangible asset;
fees to register a legal right; and
amortisation of patents and licences that are used to generate the intangible asset.

body.p: IAS 23 specifies criteria for the recognition of interest as an element of the cost of an internally generated intangible asset.
